uqiTEgbuI-fQkuMFTpJcxg.text: Pizza Union is a great place to get a quick and SUPER cheap pizza. The pizzas range from £3-7 and are all pretty delicious. They aren't the best pizzas in the world but for £3 pounds, they are pretty dang good. Just be careful, they get addicting!

AabZeY1l3EgwrGhC3zN8OQ.text: With two friends in tow we agreed that we wanted pizza after our cocktails. A gander at Yelp revealed Pizza Union. The reviews here say it all - tasty, quick, lovely staff and very cheap! Everything you want in a mid-week eat.

6SaeBk-KXkfcNviZFl72Sg.text: So cheap and yummy food. Pizza was super quick and tasted great. Reminded me of NYC pizza place. Maybe not be authentic Italian pizza, but to hang with friends and having a quick bite, I would highly recommend this place!

2hoT80y8UBVFtmXNlxmMMg.text: Awesome pizza, great value, quick service - definitely one of the best value pizza places in the neighbourhood. The fromaggio pizza is especially delicious, with different cheesy flavours you can actually taste. Nice thin crusts and good ingredients. Sit down or take away.

KDTV1f-b4DCTwiRu12cx_w.text: This place is amazing, fast, great pizza loads of natural light in the space. Couldn't think of a better lunch place than this

j1zyNsf9PpkNd9S8fpu0XA.text: Definitely one of the best pizza places in London. Although I don't know if I could claim it is truly the one best one, I haven't had any better yet and for the price it's unbeatable.

mn6lRuoIj0QvIirCh--STw.text: Excellent food and nice friendly place. The pizza bread and the sauce taste really good.

WdvS3DlxkMYmI5hwQ6Y9aw.text: Opened on the 27th July. We've been there three times in just over a week and referred a number of friends. Everyone loves it! Can't believe others haven't yelped already. It's brilliant. Pizza tastes great, thin crust and is light. Staff are so friendly and prices are excellent. A loyal crowd are building. They do take always and very simple eat in option. I'd like to keep this place a secret but its just too good.

3AltIkk3h6ua4JXargJbUA.text: Stumbled across this pizza place while looking for the Cotswold at Algate. First thing I noticed was the fire blazing in the stone oven. It is simply furnished with a long bar tables in the middle of the room with mixed assorted old school wooden bar stools for seating. My companion and I ordered the margherita and romana pizza.  Our pizza's came quickly in about 10 minutes or so.  There was olive oil, oregano and chilli flakes provided at the tables.  We sprinkled our pizza's with olive oil, oregano and chilli flakes and then took our first bite.  The pizza was delicious.  The crust was perfectly cooked, crunchy but slightly chewy at the same time.  There was just the right amount of tomato sauce and cheese on both pizzas.   They were generous with the prosciutto on my romana pizza but it wasn't salty or too over powering.  We polished off both pizza in no time.  And decided to try one of their pizza alla cioccolata.  It took about 5 minutes or so to cook, and we were expecting a dessert pizza. But instead we got a circular dough pastry, that resembled a pretzel sprinkled with icing sugar and cocoa. So we were slightly puzzled but hopeful. So my partner took the first bite and was instantly won over.  Inside the pizza pastry was a warm  mixture of mascarpone and nutella...it was fantastic. I can say that this place was definitely a pleasant surprise.  We will definitely come back here for our pizza fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom

zwhoCAnLRA5pBY4FHjGAcQ.text: Pizzas are very affordable especially for the area. Had a Versuvio, Romana and Stagioni - all delicious. Very friendly atmosphere, pizzas done really quick. Really a must visit if you're in the area.

5jEjrsK9j4u7QKtnnWlB6w.text: Friday night, 12 inch takeaway in about 8 minutes, that's good. Also like their system, little pager device that tells you when to pick up . and just over 5 quid too, bargain.

khjF08QmTLuhWaSJbwSlMQ.text: Amazing value for the city. The pizzas are very tasty, super quick and serivce friendly. I went for the Funghi pizza - toppings were lovely however the tomato sauce coudl do with some more seasoning (hence only 4*) Thin crispy base, NY style. Would choose this over Pizza Express round the corner any day!

GMbsszssl3znB0DAhLhxdg.text: This eatery embodies the spirit of cheap and cheerful. Not only did I walk away with a full belly and a satisfying jingle of change in my pocket, but I was already planning my next outing with friends. I tucked into the classic margherita, and while I wasn't exactly blown away flavour-wise, at £3.95 for a 12-inch, wood fired pizza I really had little room for complaint. I can definitely say this is a safe bet for a pre-night out pit stop - even if Liverpool Street isn't my usual stomping ground!

OMnehpWM2DmYtXG2w73_zw.text: LOVE Pizza Union! I was apprehensive before coming here as it seemed to be too good to be true- 12inch pizzas under £5 in central London?! I got the classic margarita for just £3.95 and it was beautiful- thin crust, fresh tomato sauce and a generous amount of cheese, perfect.And then desert. A pizza dough ring stuffed with Nutella and marscapone. I worried they'd be stingy on the filling but no, Nutella oozed out along with the creamy marscapone in exactly the right proportions. The dough was crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside.I can't recommend this place more. Cheap, quick and high quality, a rare find in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. Classico sweet pizza

N3RVGcR2Ezpj5UJiVyJfxg.text: The trouble when a place has stellar reviews like this is that we tend to expect too much. I love pizza even though usually it's deep-pan that floats my boat.  I think the mains here are incredible value for the City (a filling margherita for £3.95) and the desserts are pricier but intriguing (I had the salted caramel/peanut dough ring - a bit goopy with dough, but lovely to try).I came here with a pregnant friend and they even reheated her pizza for her (she eats very verrrrry slowwwwlllly!)So a full 5 stars for kind staff and ambience.  I think the quality of pizza is not the absolute best but still 4 stars - and quite Italian in style. I'll happily return and sample some other combos and update my review...

qdVNP76f6CJZr2obnjDJPA.text: No no no! The reviews on here are embarrassing. If you're not familiar with good pizza, please listen to the other reviews. If you are, I promise you there is no reason to try this place. Ask me to direct you to some of the other actually good places around.First of all, this is like factory style pizza. It's essentially Chipotle for pizza. Chipotle might be good, but it's certainly not great quality, authentic 5-star Mexican cuisine. Pizza Union is not only unauthentic, it's actually not good. Really.The crust is fine - just fine. It's only uniqueness is that it has cornmeal on the bottom (which I actually happen to like and it gives it a nice flavor), but is certainly not authentic in any way. Everything else is just at best mediocre.The cheese - so mediocre. It's like store bought packaged cheese. Not fresh or flavorful. The sauce - such a bizarre combination of super acidic and sweet that it got to be way too much. And I say this as a person who loves tomatoes, loves pizza sauce, loves pasta sauce, loves marinara sauce, etc...The toppings - wow. Literally 3 tiny leaves of basil constitutes a topping.The flavors don't mesh, the ingredients aren't good quality, the service isn't pleasant at all, but yes, the price is super cheap.Don't even get me started on their unaccommodating substitution policy. Absolutely no reason to go here.

KCozWG8NdEhXnK38PhsU6g.text: Crispy and thin pizza the way we like it in Rome in a really cool pizzeria with great prices and great options. Loved it!

-qFPM1W0cGnXikIUXNJjlA.text: Amazingly simple!  Super fresh ingredients and extremely fast service and delivery of the pizzas.  Cool atmosphere.  I'm a non smoker, so I ate inside even though it was a really nice outdoor area.  I'd like to suggest that if you want something cold to drink, ask for ice.  If you drink beer, don't go, cuz the beers aren't kept cold by any measure.  Maybe they'll read this and fix the situation for you beer drinkers out there. I don't drink beer, so I'm still giving five stars.  My experience was great.

knt84k1O-sbwd-ssd3KIrw.text: Just nice pizza but really cheap prices for London. I have been there with a friend and my partner and each of as had soft drink + proper pizza for something like £8/9The service could be nicer but that is what happens in places like this, where you don't have to give tips; they just don't care.

Pcp9bF2UNh4y0Dg0asnAcQ.text: Very solid pizza at a super reasonable price. Also appreciate the solid GF pizza. Would recommend.

d1ahc9i6e-Pxnp-uex3rqA.text: Great pizza, very light, the staff were very sweet and friendly. I went with family and had great desserts and perfect portions. They offer take out boxes for left overs and pretty casual

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. Nutella mascerpone

iNWEF4iCQakEnWZRzDm5Yw.text: The one and only place where I can honestly say they serve the BEST pizza ever! I like the pizza in other restaurants too but Pizza Union beats them because of the authentic Italian taste that it offers. The thin crust of the pizza allows you to taste all the flavours of the freshly picked ingredients. And last, but not least, it offers an amazing value for money! P.S.: The place wins extra brownie points with its Dolce dessert- a blend of Nutella and mascarpone baked in a freshly prepared dough... Heaven in a plate!

DEWZbmlJBUl5dXgNFzulVg.text: We have been many times and it NEVER disappoints! We love it! The pizzas are fantastic and so are the chefs who make them! Great value for money!

Wl1UJgKFE8D3kMFUYBpD0Q.text: Everything I write here sounds like someone's eBay feedback.  Fast food, great service A+++ would eat again.  But seriously, the pizza here was great, it was ready within 5 minutes of ordering and it cost less than £6 and I would eat again without a doubt.Pizza Union is a great casual dining place.  It's the same setup as ICCo on Goodge Street, order at the counter, collect a buzzer and your pizza is ready when the buzzer goes off.  They have loads of big tables which can be used communally or are ideal if you're a big group.  There was ten of us last night, we all ordered individually and the staff didn't even break a sweat.  We ordered individually and the pizzas were out within about five minutes.  This did mean that some of us were still ordering whilst others were eating but that's what I mean when I say it's casual.The pizzas are fired in a massive clay oven and are definitely better than their price would suggest.  The wine was also decent, surprisingly considering a bottle is only £11.50.  Crazy pricing for the area, I imagine it must be busy on weekday lunchtimes but on a Tuesday night it was really quiet.  I'm certain I'll be back to find out.

3EB_urAjc3C3MYYUQ7gGyg.text: Pizza Union...my fav place in London to grab a pizza. I know, I know... that's a pretty bold statement. But honestly? What's not to love about this place? Great prices - less than £6 for a delicious thin-crust pizza. Open until 11PM (I normally grab pizza for lunch, but there are times that we need a bite to eat after copious amounts of drinks after work and I'm grateful that they're still open...)Quick and great service - if you're here during the crazy lunch rush, it takes a little longer, but don't let the long line deter you! The line moves pretty quickly.Lots of seating.

7yD9nQXuyK_NDVTPmtct7Q.text: Cheap pizza served up fast.  I'm not much of a fan of the slightly biscuity based, but for the price, this is a pretty good place for a quick lunch.  The pizzas are around £6, are ordered at the counter, and then you're given a buzzer that will let you know when it's ready to collect.  The place gets fairly busy at lunchtimes, but the queue moves quickly.

c3DDmS4MZmnaubzMb8pXag.text: Great pizza, great service, and very clean. In my opinion, pizza Union is one of the better pizza places in the neighbourhood. I would rather eat there than at dominos or any other big chains. The pizza tastes fresh and tastes like actual time was put into it. I truly enjoyed my experience at pizza Union.

HVQwVn9qpcJzMrEVZy3zDw.text: Amazing pizzas at a low price, what else can I say?!  come here quite often when meeting friends and when everyone is keen on something quick but nice as well. I recommend trying the dessert pizzas. They are quite yummy but made for sharing!

9wThANqtGt3eIteqXDFoQA.text: Great pizza at very reasonable price. The environment is nice but one could argue that the music is too loud. Anyway, we had a good time here.

E5qH-0CqZo3646rfK9NE_A.text: We went to Pizza Union, a fun and funky joint near Liverpool Street. As the name would suggest they specialise in pizza and the giant wood fired oven dominating the open plan kitchen indicates that they take their work seriously. The pizzas cook in minutes and their light crispy blistered crusts are maybe the best we've had outside Italy. It's a super speedy operation, you place your order at the counter, they give you a buzzer tthat vibrates when you need to pick up your pizza. Job done. We started with a bottle of Prosecco (£15) which definitely whetted our appetite for the main event. Next followed gorgeous pizzas. The Calabria - an unusual combination of n'duja (spicy sausage) marscapone and rocket (£5.95). I really enjoyed it, the contrast between the properlyspicy sausage, more like a paste, and the creamy marscapone. The Stagoni (£6.50) a quartered pizza with four different toppings, cotto ham, pepperoni, mushrooms and artichokes. For those who have food intolerances they also do a gluten free base that I can vouche for. In our opinion, the best pizzas outside Italy we've had! Perfect thin crust and base. My only complaint is that the standard Shoreditch look (bare bricks, lots of glass) makes the restaurant cold and therefore the pizza goes cold quickly too. But save space for dessert for they do dough rings filled with Nutella and marscapone (£2.95), that are things of beauty. You might feel dirty afterwards but whilst it lasts it's a joyous experience, biting into warm dough, feeling the Nutella squirt over your fingers. Go with someone who already loves you because this is not an attractive look (unless you have niche tastes...). Go, the pizzas are cheap and great, what more do you want?

K7MPpIE55B9DVXNISe5qhw.text: Amazing pizzas for the price!The place has a really nice set up. Lots of long high wooden tables dominate the area with a few smaller low tables around the edges. Really high ceilings as well.It's all self-service. Order at the counter and you get a buzzer which flashes when your pizza is ready. I believe all the pizzas were under £6 and the one I had (Reine) was great. The only (tiny) gripe I have is that they only have 1 type of red/white wine and I didn't think it was that great but it was definitely decent for £11.5 for the bottle.

mB_DWQMvFingb2YtPevE7Q.text: Fast, relatively cheap, great thin crust pizza.Setting is cool and trendy. Spacious inside.Service is good and fast.What's not to love about this place?

M0p4OfzrIaV1uOCYZEjrBQ.text: I've been here quite a few times as it's round the corner from my office and I'm a big fan.The pizzas are delicious and very reasonable for central London. Service is always pretty speedy and you order at the counter so it's perfect for a quick lunch.They also do a chocolate dessert doughnut ring type thing using the pizza dough which is worth a try if you've got a sweet tooth!

mAaGrq6iLgfQ6NpW0AV-1w.text: This place is fantastic!The food was ready in no time and cooked to perfection and was incredibly cheap!I would highly recommend eating here.

NT5WERK008_5LJZ5TaJPhA.text: Excellent pizza and for very reasonable price.  I can't recall eating a meal with a glass of wine for under £20 elsewhere in London - I think I landed around £12 all-in. Great ingredients, fast service, off the beaten path where tourism goes, which gives it more of a neighborhood feel, if there's such a thing to be had in a city of London's scale...great place.

JmdzwvlcMk28FpqhEYJuQA.text: My new favourite pizza spot in London! They are affordable, in a central location near Liverpool Street, and what's most important is that they have delicious and tasty pizzas. The atmosphere is relaxed and trendyYou choose the pizza you like off of the menu board, then you're given a buzzy square thingy (I'm sure this has a proper name, but you'll know what i mean if you go here), the pizzas get baked in a large pizza oven and then you wait in suspense to see which of your friends buzzer squares will light up and give you a mild heart attack first (lots of laughs all around).As you might have guessed by now, handing in the flashing buzzer gets you your order and then it's yum yum pizza time!

yZ_lMmqMd39Rn6yvNN_7sw.text: Amazing value for money pizza in the heart of London! Was craving for some affordable pizza and pizza Union came my way! Absolutely tasty and I'll be back for more

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. Amazing pizza funghi!

TfcceG9LdfO2aYCxCyA2ZQ.text: Pizzas are nice and thin the prices is cheap compare to other good pizza places in London. Would have given 5 Star if they didn't charge 50p for their homemade garlic mayo. Atmosphere is always good here.

zHymTPsNhWny1raVvCpDxw.text: Pizza is love, guys. Last week we decided to pay a visit to Pizza Union in Spitalfields, to get some cheesy, tomato-y, dough-y goodness and see how their 'Superfast' tagline holds up.SpeedUnlike your usual city restaurant, there are no waiters and waitresses to take your order or bring your food out. Instead, you order and pay at the counter then take a small piece of plastic that buzzes and flashes when your order's ready. And from ordering to recieving our pizzas, it took around 7 minutes. TasteWe ordered up a Vesuvio (pepperoni, green chillies, cracked chillis) and a Carne (beef, chicken, pepperoni, onions). Toppings were full of flavour and fresh-tasting. The fire-baked bases are VERY thin with a super crispy crust. Considering the speed and price of the pizza, the quality is actually very impressive. However, drinks-wise I'd avoid the house white as it's not that great - stick to beer or soft drinks. PriceThe prices at Pizza Union range from just £3.95 for a Margherita up to a maximum of £6.50 for ones with lots of toppings - which is excellent value for eating out. The rest of the menu is kept simple - with three variations of side salad (£2.95-£3.95) and three fillings for a warm dough ring dessert (£2.95-£3.95). Beer's from £3 a bottle, and wine's from £3.20 a glass. Total cost for two of the top end pizzas, a basic salad, garlic dip and two drinks was £21.AtmosphereWith wooden tables, neon lights and exposed brickwork walls, Pizza Union Spitalfields definitely has a bit of a hip, 'Shoreditch-y' vibe - except it's actually pretty much slap-bang in the middle of the corporate, suit-filled city. Heading in on a Friday night, it was lively but not overcrowded and we managed to find a table easily enough.Pizza Union have got casual dining absolutely sorted - offering quality pizza at affordable prices. Perfect for a quick lunch if you're working in/visiting the city, or just a fun evening out with mutually skint friends.

nCql_RA5LrgagZqUveIlXA.text: Wow. How have I lived within spitting distance of this place and never eaten here before? It's fantastic! 1) Cheap and beyond cheerful. Pizzas are about £5 for a generous 12 inch personal thin crust pizza. Get a beer or glass of wine plus olives to nibble and you're still under £10 all in. Great value.2) Fast. My pizza was lovingly made within minutes and came out hot and crispy.3) Lively. Open seating and loud music makes this a fun weekend dinner with friends.4) Spacious. Big bonus points for Spitalfields ambiance without cramming you in.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. My chef took a bow and handed me this masterpiece

5eTsGNErzXZ727oB0iaKXw.text: This is possibly the cheapest pizza in central London. When I saw the menu I thought I was looking at the starters they were so cheap! But to my surprise these were the main event, for between £3-6.5. We came on a Tuesday night & thoroughly enjoyed it. The pizza was really amazing, really thin & crispy base, just how we like it. The flavours were lovely too, and they didn't skimp on the toppings. Nice chilli oil on the table which we drank, it was so delightful. Would definitely recommend this place!! Cheap drinks too and a nice ambiance. Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. Cool vibe
Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. Carne and Regina

hhuTOFKMBs-2eHdVDXYz2A.text: Behold traveller:Oasis amidst London,Good and cheap pizza.

J83PfTP0wEoUoLv8iNttuQ.text: Looking for a cheap place to have something reasonnable to eat and get a good catch up with your friends: you find it! Pizza Union it is. What I like about it: first it's cheap... I know I said it already but a pizza for £6.50 that have some taste, not easy to find in London right? So it's important to point it out (twice! ) Then, who does not get annoyed when the bill comes in, you know you have ordered something cheap and the big question comes in: we share the bill?! (Euuuhhh nope! Loll) anyway, no questions of that here! Everyone goes to the till, order what he wants and pays for his meal! Done! And finally the taste: nice choice of pizza that could suit everyone (veggie, tuna, pepperoni, chicken, cheese, etc) and even if I found the dough a bit too slim, the pizza was nice and cook on wooden fire so it give it a nice taste! They also have desserts. We tried the Nutella and mascarpone... To share because you will get fast too much of it but OMG, I do love Nutella and in a warm dough with the mascarpone, that was... Yummy (and fat sorry I have to say it :) So here you go, you want to spend some nice time with your friends but you (or your friend) don't want to spent too much money, just go there, this place would do the job!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. Nutella and mascarpone pizza!
Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. Pizza Union menu - February 2016
Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. Tuna pizza

tHQg1x10_se-ymOf43Svvg.text: Crowded with locals.. Because tourists don't seem to know of it just yet ;) run by friendly Italians, the pizza is delicious and cheap! And that dolce with mascarpone and Nutella... It wouldn't stop oozing out. So good. For a meal just short of £7, I'm so glad I got to try this place out

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom

FCIhfqQgZsv4IfVMvEN53g.text: I love this place. Awesome atmosphere, excellent food and good prices.So I used Yelp to sniff out a decent pizza place in central London and it didn't disappoint! The pizzas are freshly prepared and cooked with a good selection of topping available and all for £6 a pizza - sorted!The choice of drink is good (anywhere that sells Birra Moretti gets a thumbs up from me) and again reasonable (for London) prices on the bottles. The locally produced gelato is amazing, I highly recommend the coffee flavour.Also on the menu and defiantly worth trying if you haven't before is the Dolce 'pizza' which is a dough filled with Nutella and mascarpone, cooked then dusted with icing sugar and cocoa powder (think a sweet Nutella mini-calzone) - oozy Nutella heaven.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom

TCukn5FJU172CHsov84Zng.text: Great pricing and scrumptious pizza, the perfect combination. Pizzas are made to order, so you can freely customise yours, and freshly stone baked for you. At busy times there's quite a wait, but it's very much worth it, the pizza tastes amazing!

CVvSL1J2pZCIHbx7zsEiyg.text: Really unfortunate that these franchises aren't suitable for vegan/vegetarian/halal/kosher eaters.Unfortunately the cooks don't wear gloves or wash their hands regularly and are constantly contaminating vegetables by touching meat all the time. If they had one cook who does vegetables and cheese and the other does meat then that would solve the problem. Customer service is 1st class and pizza tastes great

KGUisHmrS59VOjQ0uwWKUQ.text: Baffling how this place maintains super low prices on their high quality fare--personal (yet quite substantial) pizzas (£4-£6), bowl salads (£3-£4), and bottles of prosecco (£15) and white (£11.50). Though I am not a pizza fan, this place serves up a variety of great options in a trendy yet very casual atmosphere (order at the counter, grab a pager, and take a seat at a communal cafeteria-like table). A slightly longer wait during the busy times, so plan accordingly, but it's worth the patience and you can snack on small containers of nuts and olives while waiting. Outdoor seating is a wonderful option in the warmer months. Great ambiance, friendly staff, and you can get a hearty multi-course meal for under £10.

deIobtZt276I-y1h_OdERQ.text: Really good pizza and surprisingly cheap. Only con is that it's really hard to grab a table on a weekend, so I definitely don't advise coming with a large group. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. Half pepperoni, half rheine. I love you pizza

r8sCs6U_zj209TGFB_95IA.text: This is the future. Pizzas served fast at £7 max.Tried them all and never been disappointed.The best fast food in the city.

QOa0OsG4sS1SopLlXSkqzQ.text: One of the best pizza places I've been to! Thin bases with generous toppings! It's pretty easy to eat a whole one to yourself. They have a good range of options for veggies! Still comes second to Homeslice in my mind though

9BySEgu5Ic19w2ibyaE-eQ.text: So cheap but so good. Great pizza base, fair amount of toppings. Really tasty. Get here early so you miss the lunch time rush, though to be honest it moves pretty quick. It is very loud so probably better place for social catch ups rather than work ones.

_Iraixn9HMiu_hFiu-zqoA.text: The line moves quickly.  First, grab your beverage.  Beers, wine, prosecco, mineral waters, sodas, coffee, tea & cocktails.  Second, gelato is on offer.  Chocolate, white chocolate, pistachio, salted caramel and cookies & creme.  Third, mixed olives & dips.  Order your salad and pizza.  Pay and your given a lighted coaster pager.  It will light up within 5 minutes.  Pizza comes out of oven quickly. Grab it at pickup area.  Pizza is wafer thin and crispy.  Toppings are fresh, delicious and savory.  Great value for your money.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. "Formaggi"
Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. buzzer lights up when pizza ready
Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. "Funghi"

l4jsVrzed6kIO-oJE7apwA.text: Who says London prices are extortionate? Well, they are, but thankfully Pizza Union has you covered for fast and cheap, 12 inchers right in the centre.Most of the pizzas are around 5.95 and although the ingredients are not inspired or very original, there are some interesting ones like the Calabria featuring mascarpone and Nduja spicy sausage. They have white pizza as well which can be a nice way to change things up.It's sharing bench seating and the drinks are as cheap and cheerful in the variety of the selection - couple beers and cheap wine. Really great for a group of friends when it's the end of the month and you're starting to use all the change you've been throwing into your bag / on your bedside table.

AGCr6d9vZhhbDyxWV62YQQ.text: Popped by on a Thursday night and loved the food and ambiance! We ordered two pizzas with a bottle of wine and olives, super good food and quite cheap for what you get. My favourite was the Tropicali - it's like a Hawaiian pizza with ham and pineapple. We also ordered the Vesuvio which had a kick to it. I'll definitely be back!

0piOFuz5LabpiRhAimV-dw.text: Seriously, where can a man get a meal for £5 in London!? No where!! Wrong wrong wrong! Pizza Union can do a meal for that!Is it the best pizza? No. Is it special? hmm not really. But hey it is one decent pizza for a fiver and what more can you ask for! It is properly decent with a good environment to chill and catch up with friends for. On top of that, it is fresh made pizza, so shut up and take my money!

IlRrVUHgo-yylNEoqy9p_A.text: It's always really, really busy in here around lunchtime but the staff are so efficient and attentive that I never spend longer than five minutes in the line.You'd be hard pressed to find anywhere else in London offering an entire pizza for as little as £3.95. I came here on a work lunch and it was absolutely fantastic value for money plus that atmosphere is great whatever the occasion. Obviously it's not going to be the best pizza you've ever had in your entire life but it's filling and they are generous with the toppings so you can't really go wrong with it!

lvavRv0FVjp7kcVMbjuskg.text: Great pizza although the options are pretty boring compared to other pizza places. Also dinking a star because I would be charged £1 for having the onions replaced by something else. Seriously, that is just gouging the customer as it costs you NO extra to just switch an ingredient. So I ended up just getting the Giordano sans onions. Very tasty, thin crust pizza with fresh tomato sauce and a healthy amount of yellow pepper topping. Also cheapppp!!! £5.95 for a 12-inch pizza is a steal.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom

7UtGAO3h1trqyXrM0WrWuQ.text: Pizza union is a great stop in between your bar hopping or tourist destination runs. It has awesome thin crust pizza and the prices are great for London proper. Good beer selection and it's pretty casual, re large table seating also makes it ideal for groups. Management and cashiers are all amazing. Great variety and good for all types. The doughnut Nutella dessert is also amazing so definitely give it a shot when you're in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. Walk up ordering and cheap menu

Km_miF35O7mEVM1LkEGODg.text: They are generous with toppings, especially chicken! It wasn't over cooked and was still moist and tender.  Most places serve it dry and barely edible.  Glad I came here and would definitely come back. Inexpensive.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. Pollo

7JpoanNxt6mITCQwTPAG6Q.text: Awesome pizza - even after 10 pm!If you are hungry and stepping by - go for it!Really good and reliable prices-would come here again!

rBWG66026JZN0PLNR2YLwA.text: Love this place! Great value for fresh and quick pizza!The staff inside are usually very busy however they always seem to take the time of mentioning a hello if they have seen you come in before!Very cool vibe inside pumping music with the roar of the pizza oven in the background, great for lunches during the week with the team. The pepperoni is my favourite from the large majority of the menu I have gone through. Thin and crispy pizza with a great sweet tomato sauce base!

QSy7SrsBwHjvp3j-DENuMA.text: Really enjoyed our stay, small but diverse menu, very friendly staff at the counter. Pizza was delish and ready in less than 5 minutes! Do note that this is a self-service place. Quite busy on a Friday night, and maybe for some a tad too noisy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom

GpTq0gTiM6n1IbVYpo5mjA.text: Pizza Union is my favourite go-to place for when you need a quick, filling meal for a decent price. With a range of 12 inch pizzas going for between £5 and £7, and glasses of wine for less than £3, and in such a central location, you really can't go too for wrong. My favourite pizza would have to be the Formaggi which comes with a generous helping of several different cheeses - including blue cheese, so don't choose this if you're going to have a business meeting or a date - and the Manzo as the minced beef just tastes so good. It takes Pizza Union 3 minutes to make a pizza, and, to the best of my knowledge, they've usually been pretty quick even when the place has been packed. I've not been here at lunch time yet but there are signs which stipulate that customers are limited to four pizzas each during lunch so there is some crowd control going on there.If the pizza isn't enough to fill you up, you could opt for the nutella dessert pizza or a small tub of gelato to finish off. I'm usually full though so haven't had the chance to try them out despite my numerous visits here.

945ilPRwDjb1IUrQTgn5RQ.text: Sorta difficult to understand how they can make such good pizza and sell it for so little. This is by far the best option for quick, cheap, hot food near Spitalfields, especially at night. You'll be hooked quickly.

Rd0nxXuYpIw5MoJ9er4Xvg.text: Excellent pizza and probably the most affordable meal my son and I had on our whole trip. We got a pizza, two bottled waters and I had a glass of wine, all for under £12. The service was great, the girl taking our order laughed and joked with us and was super helpful. The restaurant itself was very clean and nicely decorated. It was very nice to have such good food in a nice environment for a more than reasonable price. Definitely a place we will visit when we're in the city again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. Seriously so thin!! Perfect.
Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. A great spin on typical pepperoni pizza with perfectly crispy, thin crust, and just the right amount of spice!

LMw_Q28cUV8z6gApcTNZbg.text: Whoop! Finally, thin crust pizza! I like that it's casual, and you pay upon ordering (no messy bills) and it's self service - the establishment function a wee bit like vapiano! For what you get, the price is cheap (£5 ish to £6.50 for a pizza) and potentially hard to beat in such a location. Oh, and they did sell gelato! Didn't try it as my tummy wasn't feeling too well, but I did see quite a good amount of people buying it. I'll probably head back and give it a try next time ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom

SSduuB7A9x6YiQd313K6KA.text: Personally this is my favourite pizza joint in the city. Not only are the crusts thin and crispy and the toppings fresh but for the price of no more than £6.50 a pizza it simply cannot be beaten!My personal favourite is Stagioni as I'm greedy and it's like having 4 pizzas in one, but the carne is also excellent!A few pointers:1. The olives are great!2. Definitely have a salad on the side!3. Drinks selection is limited so don't go expecting a luxury glad of wine. 4. There's no table service but what there is is some seriously speedy pizza makingEnjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom. My fav pizza spot! :)

tRTjnuT34do9SW9huZWi1w.text: I discovered Pizza Union right on the doorstep of work almost and I'm so happy I hadn't found it sooner or else I would be the size of a house!Superfast pizzas for between £5 & £7 and they were so good. I've even made a mental note so that I know what I'm going to have next time and there will definitely be a next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pizza Union - London, United Kingdom

CXWvVBa_dz6t3Jv505UjKg.text: Dear Amazing Pizza Place, Where have you been all my life (in London)? Your food is delicious and your price is amazing. If I have to be honest, you are a perfect stop over from going between cocktail bars. But also for office people who want a quick bite to eat before heading home or during the lunch hour. You are the perfect specimen for elegant efficiency. I think I love you. Seriously, this place does amazing pizzas on the cheap. You can customize your pizza, add toppings and it's super cheap for being in the center of London. I am definitely coming back in the near future.... possibly with a date... possibly on my own (it's that good).

8mQKSW-erRbHqkb_P9ZJFA.text: All you need for pizza; quick, tasty and affordable. Been to Pizza Union a couple of times and it's great. Bench like tables make it fantastic for big groups. Large range of pizzas for all types makes it hard to choose. They have tables outside that are fantastic for enjoying a slice in the summer Suns.

_EwuD3uc3GZyCuX1gruK4g.text: Pizza union is the best!! The staff here is so friendly and the pizza is soooo good. I got the margarita with olives and mushrooms. It's insanely cheap for the high quality of food. Cheers!
